data.text: @roseuune @Suharso_M @Jiwamudaindo Suport Goverment do the best for Indonesia 📌📌

Actually, school children are also facing boredom. What I worry about is that there is a learning loss where the children are reluctant to go to school. They prefer to study at home, in the end, they lose the golden time for socialization,” he said. @Suharso_M @Jiwamudaindo

The Minister also revealed that the capacity of the health service system, especially the availability of beds, was still able to accommodate Covid-19 patients, the Minister also had time to comment on the boredom that many people experience during the Covid-19 pandemic. https://t.co/XUszF72Zbh

The Minister added that cases of the Omicron variant in Indonesia currently reach 99.57%. “Indonesia’s testing capability is higher than other Asian countries but still lower than Malaysia,” said the Minister.
@Suharso_M @Jiwamudaindo

According to him, based on International Health Metrix Evaluation (IHME), the use of 80% masks and an increase in the 3rd dose of the vaccine will accelerate the decline in cases

“From now to April to May it is projected that Omicron cases will decline. @Suharso_M @Jiwamudaindo
